(CNN) Supreme Court Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg said Thursday she regrets remarks she made earlier this week to CNN and other news outlets criticizing presumptive Republican presidential nominee Donald Trump.
The unusual and apparently unprecedented battle of words between a justice of the Supreme Court and a presumptive presidential nominee continued Tuesday.

Supreme Court Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg  —   who was appointed to the court by President Bill Clinton  —   issued a statement on Thursday saying she regrets her “ ” remarks about presumptive Republican nominee Donald Trump.
